description: This was packed during lunch......so i figured it must be good.  It was good...great assortment of dishes.  An excellent option for great food on the go. They do have limited sitting...so make sure to be early if you want to dine in
author: JAN I.

description:
As a selective trend follower I selected to follow the trend of Thursdays being the new Fridays last night 1 because I'm super chic and 2 because I really wanted to get hammered and I'll take any excuse (from not wanting the booze to go bad to my crippling loneliness). So Friday morning I joined the ranks of the super hung over co-workers and in between the naps I was trying to sneak in and the intermittent paper shuffling sounds I would make to sound like I was working I realized two things: sacrifices must be made to be super trendy (such as work productivity and the contents of your stomach), and I really needed something greasy. 

So for lunch me and a co-worker decided to get Mexican for lunch, and we stumbled upon this place in our search for anything with a cartoon sombrero on it. We chose this place because of the fancy décor in the style of: Every Other Mexican Food Joint EVER, and that they had a salsa bar of lies and deceit (will explain later)....no, I'm going to explain it now..... no, later. So I decided to get the chicken chimichanga and when I got my order the chimichanga turned out to be dream crushingly small (because most of my dreams involve a comically huge chimichanga). They did provide filler beans and rice and the whole plate turned out to be surprisingly filling, but what they didn't provide were the chips. I assumed from the open salsa bar that they would have chips available (hence my cordial nick name of the salsa bar) but instead it was offered in a zip-lock bag for a dollar, ONE WHOLE DOLLAR!! That's like twenty nickels! You know how many bags of candy I could buy with twenty nickels, and a time machine? Like twenty! 

The cashier was pretty friendly and upbeat and they do have free Horchata which made it better and overall the food was pretty good. The chimichanga had the right degree of crispiness and some of the salsa was surprisingly spicy. Despite the small size and what looked to be a precooked chimichanga, the meal was surprisingly satisfying and afterwards my desire to leave a flaming bag of dog poo in front of their door after I ring the bell and run away has gone down from a must do to a slight yearning. 

So over all this place offers a good meal with many different choices besides burritos (they have the option of adding fries INTO any burrito or dish they have). The downside is that the chips aren't free, but hey, you do get a free zip-lock bag with the chips you buy, and that zip-lock bag really decorated my trash and added much needed differentiation.
author: Youchen W.

description: For what Caramba is, it's 5 stars. It's tasty, fast, super-filling, and affordable. I recommend the super burrito with chicken, no rice. Expected bill $7-$8.
author: Tushar K.

description: Its right behind an AAU building- but considering Chipoltle is right in front of an AAU building and has more hype- students go there. I am almost greatful, this place doesn't get much business- it's lunch only, they close at 4pm. A  few $'s cheaper than Chipotle with more authentic cuisine and alot more options. This place is awesome. I've been here twice and had the chicken quesidilla- the best mexicn BBQ chicken i have ever had. I have never had chicken so tender in my life. Amazing flavor and authentic. All the workers are mexican and eat the actual food on breaks which is a good sign- a mexican friend of mine said that this place reminded her of the mexican family restaurants back home. It's the type of place you can come in and dine alone without feeling like a total loner like i did for an early dinner lol. Decent sized place. Doesn't matter if you wait in a line or not they take your order upfront depending on who got there first. They yell the orders out when they come and you pay to the right of where you ordered. Food is fast and good, they charge extra for sourcream or guacamole but when she asked if i wanted sourcream she did not charge me. Nice ladies nice environment including some even more secluded corner tables if you want more privacy. Never really crowded- they just close super early. If people go to Chipoltle over this place they either don't know the area, or this place is sadly closed. It's next to a bar that opens late at night and god they would get such business if they were open later! This is the place and the food is always great with large portions and is very cheap. Bang for your buck \^-^/
author: Brittainie B.

description: It's actually pretty good. I am a chile relleno guy and they have good ones.
author: Dougaldo C.

description: This place is on my way to work and on the mornings when i need a real breakfast I'll stop here and get a Popeye Breakfast Burrito. They are delicious! It has spinach which is why it's called Popeye. The portions for breakfast burrito are not huge, so you can eat it and not feel gross. The price it right, they are under $4. People are nice, you can't go wrong!
author: Colleen m.

description: Good Place for lunch.  Tasty carnitas burrito and a welcomed retreat from other places in the area.  It does get popular around lunch.
author: Adam B.

description: Worst taco in the city. A gross mess unceremoniously slapped onto a plate, which just happens to have a corn tortilla underneath it. No art in its construction at all.
author: Tom H.

description: One of my favorite lunch spots in soma! I was really surprised that the carne asada burritos rivals those in the Mission and Fruitvale. What more could you want for under $8 :)
author: Kirk R.

description: If you love yourself some carnitas burritos like I do, then you NEED to hit up this place. I used to work around the corner from Caramba and I think I came a bit too often, now it's like a 20 minute walk so I only get it on occasion, and what sweet occasions those are! I have never had anything else here besides the carnitas burrito, but really that's all I need...my suggestion to take your burrito to the next level, add some cilantro! I have an obsession with cilantro, but I truly believe all people should be as obsessed as I am cuz it's THAT GOOD! I got a burrito, chips and salsa (unlimited salsa bar...you can see my feelings about those who limit salsa in my review of Los Socios...cerdos...) for less than $7. Their green salsa is my favorite...but if you can handle it, my true fave is mixing their green and red together, so deeeeeeelicious!
author: Amanda S.

description: Very good carnitas, I stop by here on the way back to the office from the gym.  Reliably good burritos, friendly staff, the owner is always at the register.  Good salsa verde.  -1 star for no free chips.
author: Alex K.

description: This place is seriously awesome.  I go here for lunch often and sometimes for breakfast.  Their burritos are good portions, and love the prices for breakfast..
author: Raja D.

description:
Wow... this place is good!!

Caveat: I'm a vegetarian, so can't comment on the non-veg options.

I generally go for a straight-up veg burrito-- rice, beans, cheese, salsa.  Everything here is spot on... the ingredients are fresh and the burrito is packed well.  On top of that, the salsa bar has some really kick-butt salsa.

Now, generally, I will just get my burrito and that lasts me through the day, but on two occasions I've ordered the "wet" burrito... warning: only order this if you are very hungry.  For some reason (perhaps because they don't have to wrap the burrito in foil), there's just a lot more of everything in the burrito and their enchilda sauce is brilliant.

I'm getting hungry just thinking about this place.
author: Sunil S.

description: Simple burritos, but it hit the spot for being in my neighborhood. I was able to get a nice small veggie burrito. It really was just what I wanted, but I admit that their prices were kind of expensive. I was amazed that it was going to cost me close to $7 for two regular tacos. It still beats the pants off Chipotle when I have a burrito craving at lunch time.
author: Netty L.

description: I go there regularly. I usually get the veggie taco, which is super cheap and is a heap of food! They also often offer free agua fresca and have a salsa bar. Worth eating at!
author: Tim R.

description: Si Senor's burritos are waaay better than Chipotle's. The spicy chicken salad and tostada are muy delicioso.
author: Connie C.

description:
it is not chipotle. that's about it.
taqueria no-no: chips are not included. what the hell? minus a star!

why isn't there a decent burrito place in this area?!
author: Adrienne Y.

description: Super carnitas burrito is really good -- not too big, not too small.  I've also had the taquitos, which were OK.
author: Mitzi C.

description: The steak burritos are good, and it's a nice place to eat lunch by yourself, but the five-star rating goes to the highly addictive breakfast burritos. Unlike the pretentious overzealots who add things like black beans, or worse, spiced potatoes!! to breakfast burritos, Si Senor makes them like you would if you were in your house at home watching DVDs of tv shows. This review just got a bit too personal. Eggs, bacon, salsa, cheese, that's it. Every morning on the way to work I wonder if I should stop and get one. I could probably build a shelter for the homeless out of all of the breakfast burritos I have consumed there this year.
author: Caitlin P.

description: Decent burritos in the Yelpborhood.  I like to sit in the window and watch people walk past.
author: Brian J.

description: Whenever my friend and I meet up for lunch during the work week, we can never resist this place.  Our favorite is the enchiladas which also come with rice and beans.  I've also had burritos and tacos here, but can't get enough of the enchiladas.  They also offer french fries in your burritos which I've never had here but am definitely a fan of in general.  Also can't beat coke in a bottle.
author: Emma S.

description: I Love the taste of their food but, They never get the order right especially on take out...Never more frustrationg then getting back to your office and have you mouth watering only to find out it's not what you ordered ARGGGG!
author: Paulette J.

description: The Burritos here are really juicy and filling and the price is pretty good.  They give you chips (but not many) but you can purchase s pretty good sized bag of chips for $1 and they have a good Salsa Bar.  I'm a fan.
author: Peter W.

description: Easily the worst burrito I've had in San Francisco. Carne asada was in no way fresh and lacked any flavor except a slightly rank saltiness. It reminded me of a cabeza (head meat) burrito I had in the Mission, except in a bad way. Despite ordering the "spicy" salsa, the entire super burrito was a flavorless mush. Didn't help that everything here -- the salsa, the sour cream, the guacamole -- seemed to be two parts water, one part substance and one part blugh. Was also an unusually messy experience -- kinda like trying to eat a tortilla filled with a soupy plate of pre-chewed Mexican food. Next time I want a burrito that bad I'll just ride BART to the Mission and take a long lunch.
author: Carlos B.

description:
I've been trying for a while to find a great lunchtime burrito, and here it is!

It's a longer walk from my office than I would like, but I still make the journey regularly and I'm always glad I did.  The burritos here are fantastic, service is fast, and one of these days I'm going to try the french fries in the burrito option - how awesome is that?
author: David B.

description: Oh. My. God. I ordered the chicken fajitas and they gave me a gigantic plate of food--black beans, rice, guac, sour cream--all the fixings. It was amazing, fast, and cheap. But with all that food, they only gave one tortilla :( I mean, it was a big tortilla, but I needed at least 3 for all the food they gave me.
author: Aunt B.

description: Excellent lunch burritos, we make a 3-4 block hike past 2-3 other burrito places to come here. Service is fast, burritos are tasty.
author: Brian H.

description: I just ate here yesterday for the first time and it is my new favourite place to get a burrito in the financial district.  I guess it's technically in SoMa but it's a hop, skip and a jump from my work.  I got the shrimp burrito there and it was so good I finished it.  I have never finished an entire burrito before.  The shrimp was good quality (not those tiny baby frozen shrimp) and the rice tasted so good!  I guess I was too used to El Faro because I got savage with my burrito.
author: Mahogany G.

description: Food is average. I usually get the super veggie burrito. I agree with a previous poster that they're a bit stingy with the fillings. I only go here when I'm really desperate for some Mexican food (not many choices near work). Also, they only have flour tortillas (no wheat tortillas). Not a memorable place.
author: Wendy L.

description:
French fries inside my burrito for just a dollar extra!!!  I've been looking for a place like this since I left SoCal!  
Great food, service is so-so mostly because they get busy during the lunch rush.  An excellent downtown lunch spot, I will absolutely go back.
author: eamon g.

description: Pretty good burritos at decent prices for the fidi.   Grilled chicken super burrito with black bean and spicy salsa hit the spot.  they were generous with the sour cream and guacamole, and the spicy salsa mixed with the creamy stuff were happy in my mouth
author: Legal D.

description: Food is prepared very quickly, good portions, and inexpensive.  I would come here again, not a bad place to come for lunch and not crowded.
author: Gena O.

description: I stopped in for a "super burrito"  yesterday, and I didn't even notice this place ain't called "SI Senor" anymore. The food is still the same, fresh and good quality tacos y burritos.
author: Aaron B.

description: A good place for lunch.  I usually get the Enchaladas.  Fast service, but sometimes I feel like I am at the Taco Nazi.  I have to wonder, if you have a sign up for something being a special for so long that you had to adjust the price, is it really a special?
author: Pele N.

description:
The service is quick.  Seemingly more choices than other average Mexican places. I liked the medium salsa, different from your usual. The food is nothing to rave about. 
Good for a quick take out or sit down lunch. No standing space, so be prepared to be jostled in a crowd.
author: Chandra I.

description:
This review is based solely on breakfast.  I have never eaten lunch or dinner here.

I definitely recommend the breakfast burrito.  It is delicious.  The eggs are cooked fresh to order, there is a salsa bar, and they serve breakfast until 10:30am, which is later than some of the other places around.  I would give the bfast burrito here the edge over the ones at the nearby Rico Mex on Stevenson.

Note: $0.40 charge for paying with credit card
author: Tim C.

description: Caramba always treat me well, they have excellent carnitas, salsa is amazing, the horchata is perfect, and they have really really good tacos. Best financial district Mexican food in my opinion.
author: Jason S.

description: I have to admit I was a little hesitant to enter at first. It's small, in the middle of the block, not a familiar name. But then I saw the sure sign of a good Mexican place: people of that nationality eating there. Phew. I felt safer already. This is the best place for a burrito anywhere in the area. They have strawberry pinafels and coke in bottles! See, I HATE Chipoltle. Baja Fresh isn't bad, but it's not great either. I don't understand $8 for a burrito and an extra $2 for guacamole. Wha? So when I found this place that has the chicken burrito in sauce which I adore, with sour cream and guac for a mere $7, I was thrilled! Chips for a mere .90 more. A place to fulfill my mexican food cravings near school that is not owned by McDonalds or Pepsi Co. And I get to continue my love of supporting locally owned and operated businesses. I am currently trying to convert all my classmates to going there. I do have to take off a star for not taking debit cards as I am one of those people who NEVER has cash, but planning ahead to make sure I can afford my lunch is well worth it.
author: Lisa M.

description: same as my rico mex review except they don't take credit cards...
author: Swarup B.

description: Love this place. The best pork carnitas in all of SF!!!! Their pork carnitas tacos are second to none! Yummy food and a clean place to eat.
author: John A.

description: today i had a super-intense craving for enchilladas for lunch here in the fidi.  not a fun thing to deal with down here since there aren't a lot of solid choices for a sit-down experience.  i found this place on yelp as touted one of the best places downtown (which isn't saying much).  luckily i got my enchillada craving fulfilled to the minimum requirements.  next time this happens i hope i am a little closer to puerto allegre.
author: e w.

description:
I have become addicted to Caramba and eat there at least once a week. I am from Texas so I like Tex-Mex and Caramba is the only place that I've found that compares to what I grew up with.
  I alternate only two platters when I go there..either the cheese enchilada's or the Carne Asada. Besides the tasty enchilada sauce Caramba uses cheddar cheese which gives it more flavor. It's a big platter but I manage to stuff down every last bite.  
   Now to the Carne Asada!  Whatever they marinate the meat in they are doing it right! I usually stuff a large flour tortilla with everything but truthfully I could eat the meat by itself because it's so good.
   The staff is friendly and it is quick service though you do have to wait a few for the Carne Asada to be made.  The only con I have is that they won't serve Carne Asada past 2 p.m eventhough they are open until 3:45.
    Give this place a shot! Everyone I have taken there has already been back a few times by themselves.
author: Dexter S.

description: They've been making me a wonderful gluten free burrito (without the tortilla) for breakfast every weekday for the past several weeks.
author: Adam T.
